title: Keivan Bolouri
text:
About me
Hello! My name is Keivan Bolouri. I am passionate about technology, data, and continuous learning.
I enjoy building projects, exploring new tools, and applying what I learn to real-world problems.

title: Keivan Bolouri
text:
Education

University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA)
Bachelor of Science (in progress)
Focus areas: computer science, data analysis, and applied problem-solving.
Additional coursework and self-study:
Programming, research, and independent technical projects.


Outside of academics, I enjoy hiking, running, and staying active outdoors.
Feel free to explore my links above to learn more about my work and interests. ✨ Result

References
[1] Stewart, James. Calculus: Early Transcendentals. 8th ed. Cengage, 2015.
[2] Larson, Ron. Elementary Linear Algebra. 8th ed. Cengage, 2017.
[3] Epp, Susanna S. Discrete Mathematics with Applications. 5th ed. Cengage, 2019.
[4] Zill, Dennis G. A First Course in Differential Equations with Modeling Applications. 11th ed. Cengage, 2018.
[5] Friedberg, Stephen H., Arnold J. Insel, and Lawrence E. Spence. Linear Algebra. 5th ed. Pearson, 2024.
[6] Ross, Sheldon M. A First Course in Probability. 10th ed. Pearson, 2019.
[7] Burden, Richard L., J. Douglas Faires, and Annette M. Burden. Numerical Analysis. 10th ed. Cengage, 2015.
[8] Rice, John A. Mathematical Statistics and Data Analysis. 3rd ed. Cengage, 2006.
[9] Sheather, Simon J. A Modern Approach to Regression with R. Springer, 2009.
[10] Kutner, Michael H., et al. Applied Linear Statistical Models. 5th ed. McGraw-Hill, 2005.
[11] Abraham, B., and J. Ledolter. Introduction to Regression Modeling. Duxbury, 2006.
[12] Montgomery, Douglas C. Design and Analysis of Experiments. 9th ed. Wiley, 2017.
[13] Boyd, Stephen, and Lieven Vandenberghe. Convex Optimization. Cambridge UP, 2004.
[14] James, Gareth, et al. An Introduction to Statistical Learning with R. 2nd ed., Springer, 2021.
[15] Robert, Christian P., and George Casella. Introducing Monte Carlo Methods with R. Springer, 2010.
[16] Bishop, Christopher M. Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning. Springer, 2006.
[17] Durrett, Rick. Essentials of Stochastic Processes. 2nd ed. Springer, 2012.
[18] Zhou, Qing. Course Notes for STATS 102B. UCLA.
[19] Isaaks, Edward H., and R. Mohan Srivastava. An Introduction to Applied Geostatistics. Oxford UP, 1989.
[20] UCLA Statistics 100C course handouts.
http://www.stat.ucla.edu/~nchristo/statistics100C/
[21] Wickham, Hadley. Advanced R. 2nd ed. Chapman & Hall/CRC, 2019.
[22] Jones, O., R. Maillardet, and A. Robinson. Introduction to Scientific Programming and Simulation Using R. CRC Press, 2009.
[23] Chang, Winston. R Graphics Cookbook. O’Reilly, 2012.
[24] Zieffler, Andrew, et al. Comparing Groups Using R. Wiley, 2011.
[25] DeGroot, Morris H., and Mark J. Schervish. Probability and Statistics. 4th ed. Pearson, 2012.
[26] Hogg, Robert V., et al. Probability and Statistical Inference. 10th ed. Pearson, 2019.
[27] Illowsky, Barbara, and Susan Dean. Introductory Statistics. 2nd ed. OpenStax, 2022.
[28] Adhikari, Ani, et al. Computational and Inferential Thinking. 2nd ed., 2022.
[29] Kleinberg, Jon, and Éva Tardos. Algorithm Design. Addison-Wesley.
[30] Durrett, Rick. Essentials of Stochastic Processes. 2nd ed. Springer, 2012.
[31] UCLA Statistics 100C handouts.
